Reviews.Title: Good product with a few flaws
Reviews.Author: Adriel Ziesemer Jr.
Reviews.Content: What I liked: - Price of the kit; - Easy to install and operate; - Integrated phone call unit; - Range of the sensors; - No false alarms; - WIndow/door sensor can easily be modified to control two or more wired magnetic sensors. All you need to do is connect the new dispositives in serie with the existing one; - I can call the control unity with my mobile phone and disarm the alarm before get home when I'm not with the remote control; - My phone rings within 9 seconds after the alarm is triggered; - The control unity saves a history with the time and sensor of the 5 last times it was triggered; - Works with 9V batteries;What I dislike: - Only one remote control; - Not very loud. I can barely hear it outside my apartment if the front door and the room door (where it is installed) are closed; Things get better if I install it close the door, but this way someone can easily smash it or unplug the phone cable in a few seconds. I'd rather to have an external siren; - Manual have two different procedures for remote operation of the alarm. The correct is the second one in the end of the manual where you should press a number + # to operate the control unity; - Extra accessories (especially the remote control) can be expensive and difficult to find; - Window/door sensor could be smaller; - There is a smal screw in the back of the control unity that entered inside it through a smal hole the first time I opened it to insert the battery. It was a pain to remove it later; - I'd like to have a keyboard outside home so that I can disarm the alarm without the remote control. - I didn't discover how to disarm zones without deleting the sensor from the control unity database;What was a plus (features not informed in the manual or in the product description): - Window/door sensor have a glass break detector. It triggers the control unity with impact; - WIndow/door sensor have a switch to locally play an alarm sound even if the control unity is not armed. - Control unity have 4 wire connections in the back: 1 for external siren and 3 triggers (1 normally closed and 2 normally open for extra sensors);*02/26/2011*After 6 months, the 9V battery of the motion sensors died. The battery of the window/door sensors are still OK.*6/17/2011*The control unity alerts you when the battery of the sensors are too low. If you don't fix, it can give false alarms.I removed the batteries from the motion sensors and connected to the 9V output in the control unity. Everything is working fine and I don't need to replace the batteries every 6 months anymore.*9/7/2012*After 2 years, the battery of the door sensor is still ok (have never replaced). The motion sensor batteries lasts 6-8 months.*9/28/2013*3 years and the original batteries of the door sensors are still ok... unbelievable!!

Reviews.Title: Very easy to install.
Reviews.Author: Peter V.
Reviews.Content: I live in a not so great apartment complex. I have lots of nice toys that would be very easy to hock at a pawn shop. I got worried everytime I left my apt that I'd come back to find the flimsy door kicked in and my goodies gone. I was able to install this in minutes. Two screws for the main unit and one screen for the motion sensor (mounted right above my door but out of reach to the average person. Now I can leave my place without worry.Pro: Very easy to install, keychain remote means no running to the keypad.Con: I found the working range of the remote to be about 30ft (through several walls though). Its loud but without an external siren I'm counting on my immediate next door neighbors to respond to the alarm before they disable it. Some of the setup menus are a little clumsy, but you only have to do it once.I'd buy it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Very good for the price
Reviews.Author: robert "hiker person"
Reviews.Content: This review includes the Mace Home Security unit PLUS the optional external speaker.I bought this system about a month ago. It came with both an instructional DVD plus written instructions.  Both were fairly easy to follow. It may take a couple of tries on some of the items to be programed because it will revert back to the main menu if you take too long but this is not a problem. Making sure the detectors are properly set up is a must otherwise it won't arm properly. Make sure the door/window sensor is no more than 1/4 inch apart. If either is set up incorrectly it will tell you on the lcd to please close and gives the sensor number that's not correct (included motion detector is #1 and door/window sensor is #2).  It's wise to double check phone number entries,delay times,  etc upon completion. I have the door/window sensor located in my outdoor shop about 125 feet away past three walls from the main control and it works fine. I've used motion detectors before and they can be a problem since they will detect pets or even rodents.  It's best to locate them in narrow areas (such as  a narrow hallway) to minimize the risk of a non human triggering it. The alarm is very loud and can be heard throughout my house but since I live in a rural area and also wanted to protect my detached shop, I chose the external alarm.  I would say that when set up it may have an effective range of about 200-250 feet, depending on neighborhood noises. This hopefully would scare away intruders but not sure my neighbors (about 900 feet away) would notice it.My only complaint concerns the instructions.  During my initial set up I had problems arming the system and had to call customer support.  The instructions indicated that troubleshooting information was available on their website but there was none. I was able to get a troubleshooting guide from tech support and he indicated that hopefully this would be put on their website in the future.Also, the instructions for the external siren indicated there are three different  versions of software developed over the years that required different programing methods  and the serial number of the main control unit indicated which version I had.  This proved to be incorrect and again I had to call tech support to get the correct programing procedure. The good news is that Mick at tech support was excellent. He responded quickly to my calls and walked me through the couple of minor problems I had. For me, it's not just about a great price (I paid about $72 including shipping for the Home Security package and about $42 for the optional siren) but customer support and I rate both at A+. Again, my only problem was with the instructions and hopefully these will be corrected  by Mace. I decided it still earned 5 stars based on the great support they provided.I researched a number of alarm systems and found this unit to truly be an excellent buy based on it's quality and features and I'm very satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: nice basic system
Reviews.Author: H. Dion "campFL"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this system for basic security and peace of mind. Our floorplan is an open one so the basic kit (one motion detector and one door/entry sensor were all we needed to pretty much cover 90% of the house. Had it for almost a year and had no false alarms to date and have used it repeatedly when leaving for weekend trips, etc. Tested it every time we came back by opening the door and not disarming immediately, setting it and walking in front of a sensor, etc. Calls our cell phones as programmed every time. No monthly fees, no worries. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: Mace Wireless Home Security System
Reviews.Author: Razorback61
Reviews.Content: Excellent product and well worth the money; received $48 per year discount from my insurance company as well !  Would have given it 5 stars if it had one additional feature.  When you activate a sensor while the unit is armed, it should give a warning, continuous tone for the 20 seconds before full alarm.  Sometimes we enter the home with groceries or something and go about our business forgetting that we have the security system on and trigger a full scale alarm.  This minor improvement would make this unit unbeatable!  I used several motion sensors in our home since we have 23 openings at ground level.  Entire home security system with extra sensors costs less than $150; now go beat that!

Reviews.Title: Mace wireless security System
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: This is a great product, does what it says.The only con I can find is the out door siren does not seem to be loud enough but I guess we all want the Earth to shake when this thing goes off, I wrote company about it and nothing else will work with it and they said the only option was to have more than one siren, so I ordered another and put it in a different spot. Did the trick, works well.OK, if your like me the most important thing is false alarms, I thought and thought about every other way this thing could be set off besides some one breaking in, I live alone, am 100% disabled, do not want to go to the store, come home to find my house surrounded by police (I have my unit set to call 911), guns draw, doors kicked in, well you get the picture.So, I did some experiments, you will not believe what the weakest link is, drum roll please, lol, it's the motion detector, you see, the detector works very well, to well. I wanted to test it so I hooked up a night light next to the motion detector, opened the front door and let 1 fly in, shut door, turned night light on and waited to see what would happen, bingo, the fly did not even have to land on motion detector lens, it triggered the alarm with the fly buzzing around in the air, what people must understand is a bug crawling across lens, a fly or what ever will trigger any motion detector.So in short to be 99.99% sure of no false alarms use door/window sensors only. Then you know for sure.

Reviews.Title: Works great... has a big drawback...
Reviews.Author: Love_Island_Life
Reviews.Content: This product works great except for one thing... it includes a call-in feature that allows the owner to call the home and set it's functions remotely. However, if you have an answering machine, it overrides it. So, either it picks up before the answer machine does (and nobody can leave a message) or your answering machine picks up leaving you unable to access the alarm. If you have a second home line the alarm could hook up to, that would be ideal.Oh, and the alarm instructions were written by a moron. Not good.

Reviews.Title: Good inexpensive Alarm
Reviews.Author: Geob Donte
Reviews.Content: I reviewed several alarms and after reading all reviews I have to say I made a good choice.Pros-Easy to install and setup, one time fee and no monthly service plan.Alarm will call my cell phone and 3 other numbers when triggered.Works great, I haven't received any false alarms after a month.You can arm or disarm with remote or central unit.You can add several devices(zones) to the unit for more protection.My door sets in from my frame slightly and the magnetic door/window alarm was slightly unaligned, but fortunately the alarm allowed for this little play.Cons-I wish you could arm individual zones without having to arm all zones at once, same with the test mode.For those who need more audible, you will have to purchase the exterior audible/visual siren from a third party company or ask the manufacturer if they have that available.  I did not see the exterior siren on the manufacturer's website.  The exterior unit works off of 120v with battery backup.Unit should come with a least 2 remotes, had to purchase extra remote from manufacturer.Door/window unit is bulky.

Reviews.Title: Great product (albeit 2 false alarms due to a fly)
Reviews.Author: Gagan
Reviews.Content: Great product...-clumsy menu but only one time setup required-sound not loud enough to alert neighbors-cool feature is that it dials 4 phones numbers-had 2 false alarms in two months. (triggered by fly)-very hard to judge the sensitivity/range of motion detector-once installed, it works just great as a deterrent. Low Battery indicator would have been nice

Reviews.Title: Keeps my mind at ease.
Reviews.Author: S. Lawson "Tech Guru"
Reviews.Content: This does what it says.  I will start with the dialing the phones part since this was my main concern when I ordered.  Set is easy if you follow the directions.  I put in my cell phone number, my brother in law who is a cop, and my neighbors number along with a couple of more, and this system was ringing my cell phone within a second of being set off.  I then let it keep going and it dialed everyone perfect.  You can turn it off via your cell phone, listen in own the system, talk via the system and it comes with a card that you can put in your wallet to help you remember the codes.  The only reason I didnt give it 5 stars is b/c the remote control chain for my key ring broke.(not the remote, just the chain)  For a unmonitored system and at less than a hundred when I bought it, this works great.  If you have a home with two doors, then this will work.  I put the door monitor on one door, and the motion detector in the room with the other door, and both have been working for over 3 months without having to change the batteries.  Love mine, just wish it came with 2 remotes but the keypad is easy enough to use.  Want a nice inexpensive nonmonitored system, this should do you great.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Birdieman
Reviews.Content: Too many false alarms. Bought this for a temporary install at my Mother's vacant house in a sketchy neighborhood. I told my wife this is either going to be a pain in the butt or a good deal. Turned out to be the former. Some nights I could not even set it due to false activity detected.  I have some experience with alarm systems and this was a headache to troubleshoot.  Like I said, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Straight Forward Alarm System
Reviews.Author: Ed "erod1944"
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Mace Wireless Home Security System with 6 Motion Detectors and received the system at 4PM. I had it up and running on all 6 sensors by 11PM the same day spending more time physically mounting the wireless sensors than programming the controller.I programmed the MACE Controller to call me on my cellphone and as I have a wireless sensor in the garage, I get a test call every time I park my car in the garage.  The controller is set for a 10 second alarm delay, so my cell phone rings with an "alarm call" from the Mace before the garage door finishes closing.  I disarm the MACE with the little remote while in the car.HERE'S MY SPECIFICS:PROGRAMMING:The programming is simple except for two items.1.  The programming steps in the manual are embedded within paragraphs instead of having them set out in a numbered table which makes following the steps somewhat confusing but not impossible.  The steps themselves are not that difficult. Just translating the steps to "your own programming table" would makes the process much simpler.2.  The programming sequence requires a waiting period of 20 seconds and 60 seconds (depending on what you're programming) after you enter your programming data.  You have to wait for the "BEEP" before you move on to enter other programming sequences.SENSORS:The sensors have really good horizontal coverage although the vertical coverage is slightly narrow.  I don't have any pets so I can't talk about "kitty false alarms" but I do know that when you enter the room, the sensors activate without the appearance of any dead spots.I've got sensors located all over the house and while the MACE controller is NOT centrally located, all sensors report accurately and faithfully to the MACE Controller.  All 6 sensors worked out of the box.  No problems.  The sensor mounts are inexpensive but they work well.INTERNAL SIREN:It's quite loud but your neighbors probably won't hear it.  I turned my siren function off so the bad guys can't find the MACE controler and rip it out of the wall.  I'd prefer that the Police find the bad guys engrossed in their work.THE REMOTE:My remote has a range of about 50 feet or so.  The security system is much easier to live with if you have multiple remotes. I have one in each car and one on the night stand.Incidentally, the MACE Controller programming window shows only one programming entry location for a remote.  however, you can program up to 10 remotes in that one location on the MACE Controller via "The Learning Mode".RECORDED VOICE MESSAGE:Easy to do.  The recorded voice which gets played during an "alarm call" to your programmed phone numbers is a little muffled, probably a low bandwidth recording, but it's sufficient for recognition and understanding during an "Alarm Call".MONITORING THE PREMISES FUNCTION:The microphone in the MACE Controller which is accessed by a "1#" from the "answering phone" during an "alarm call" is quite sensitive and it would be very easy to hear someone rummaging through your stuff via the monitor function in order to verify the validity of an alarm before making that Police Call.CONCLUSION:This is an inexpensive alarm system that works as promised and does a good job.  I no longer stress over home security when I'm out for a day or two.  It was money well spent.I rated the unit as 4 Stars.  It missed the 5 Star rating because of the messy programming manual.FULL DISCLOSURE:I used to configure Microwave Radios and Dantel Alarm Systems for AT&T; before I retired.

Reviews.Title: Not good
Reviews.Author: m run
Reviews.Content: I bought this hoping to avoid paying more than I wanted to for an ADT alarm. My husband used to install alarms for a company, so we were confidant that he would be able to install this. He was. The problem is the alarm is cheep.  The key pad is not lit, this makes it very hard to see what is on the screen even in the day time. The number pad is louder than the alarm itself, and it takes about 2 full minutes to activate once you push in your code to "arm" the system.  On the second day of use one of the monitors fell off the wall breaking the wire and setting off the alarm in the middle of the night. The window contacts are useless if you want glass break protection, as they do not function this way. I would not purchase this system again. In fact I did return all of the extra contacts that I bought for the windows and just use the door system. Amazon has been great about taking the returns and replacing the broken contact, however it's just more trouble than it's worth. If you do buy this put the key pad where you want the alarm to be the loudest, as that is where most of the noise comes from. When the alarm went off in the middle of the night at my house the kids didn't wake up because with the doors closed to the rooms you can not really hear the system. And that is with the extra siren hooked up as well.

Reviews.Title: suprisingly effective
Reviews.Author: sf_frequent_shopper
Reviews.Content: I have been very surprised at how well this product works considering the price. The remote motion sensor and door/window sensors work very well. The control panel is pretty easy to use. There are a couple of drawbacks, though. The noises that sound when you key in your commands and when the base is alerting you that it's doing something (not the alarm) are really loud. And, you CANNOT control the volume. It's like shockingly loud, which if you live in an apt complex, sort of ruins the element of surprise, if you want that.

Reviews.Title: Terrible - Stay Away
Reviews.Author: AR
Reviews.Content: I didn't even take this system out of the package before I returned it. The phone cord plug and power plug are on the top of the unit, not behind it. My plan was to mount this on the wall near the door so it would look and act like any other home security system. It's difficult to do that with cords coming out of the panel in plain site of any intruder. All a potential burglar would have to do is unplug the phone cord and your system isn't calling you. I'll try to upload a photo so everyone can see what it really looks like.

Reviews.Title: Not as expected
Reviews.Author: Nancy rand
Reviews.Content: The Alarm is difficult to operate.  On remote call in it Fails to give status of alarm when armed or disarmed

Reviews.Title: Works great and terrific customer service
Reviews.Author: P. Hudson
Reviews.Content: We've had this unit for over a year now for our cabin.  Just had our first false alarm.  The unit called us around midnight and the instructions on how to disarm by phone didn't work.  Couldn't tell whether it was due to being woken out of a sound sleep or wrong password or whatever but after having the sheriff's dept check the cabin and determine that it was secure, we ended up taking our home phone off the hook, shutting off our cell phones and making the 4 hour drive up to our cabin to see what was up.  Thankfully, all was fine and we had a pleasant day in the mountains on very little sleep but a nice day anyway.  Battery indicator showed low but didn't say needed to replace so we left it as we were going back up at the end of the week anyways.  We were about 35 miles down the mountain when the unit called us.  Maybe the battery was low enough to trigger a false alarm?  Maybe a very large bug?  Who knows but one good thing, I figured out how to disarm it by cellphone!  We set the unit up with only the motion sensor as our cabin is very old and the windows and doors don't exactly line up but maybe we'll try it with a door sensor if the false alarms keep happening.  All in all, we're pretty happy with this unit.2012 Update - we kept losing our dial tone when the system was plugged in. I emailed Mace's customer service and received a reply within 24 hours.  Apparently they have had instances where lightning storms can cause damage to the unit resulting in the symptom I relayed. They sent a new unit with instructions on how to sync it with the existing components. Installed with a surge protector and have gone through more than one lightning storm since with no problems!  I highly recommend this unit and superb customer service!

Reviews.Title: Alert...you need a land line
Reviews.Author: moondancer
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm just simple, but I didn't pick up the fact that you need a land line phone for this to work. You can still use it as an alarm system, but it won't call you. I'm returning it, sadly, because I did a lot of research and this looks like the best alarm system in the price range. There is only one window sensor, and additional ones are rather pricey and large, so I'm going to go with a less expensive system with more pieces.

Reviews.Title: OVER RATED! NOT LOUD ENOUGH
Reviews.Author: Deb
Reviews.Content: I don't understand how this gets a four-star rating when the alarm is barely audible. If someone breaks in, the alarm is not loud enough to be heard from another room. Alarm clocks are louder than this. Even my microwave oven is louder. If someone breaks in on you at night, chances are you won't hear it. It's too easy for a burglar to just turn off the switch that's on the side of the door alarm, but he won't need to since it's not loud enough for him to worry about. This is the worst purchase I've made on Amazon and it will be returned. I've found that the one and two-star reviews are more accurate and I wonder if the others are fake.

Reviews.Title: Low Cost, Great Performance
Reviews.Author: K. Ochiai "KR"
Reviews.Content: I took a chance on the MACE system after reading a lot of great reviews.They weren't wrong!The wireless range is outstanding on this unit.I have the control module on the third floor in my office room.The motion sensors are on the ground floor.The ground floor ceiling is solid concrete, and one entire side is below the ground, but it has no problems sending and receiving RF signals.I can even use the remote to arm and disarm the control module from the ground floor!A few small nitpicks about the system:Display is not lighted, and the settings are hard to read and very small.The keypad and alert tones are extremely loud, and can't be adjusted.The siren is not very loud from outside the house.The optional wireless siren should solve this issue.These are minor issues compared to the outstanding RF range and features packed into the MACE unit.The performance for the price is impressive.Being wireless, the system can be installed in a matter of minutes if you need to urgently secure your home.Additional motion sensors, external flashing siren, and door switches are available to expand your coverage to match your needs.Definitely recommended as one of the best low cost security systems.

Reviews.Title: Mace Wireless Home Security System
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Product is easy to set up and works extremely well. I added two more motion sensors and they were very easy to activate and install with the existing system. I would recommend this system for an effective and inexpensive security system for your house.

Reviews.Title: Good Service from Mfg.
Reviews.Author: Karl
Reviews.Content: I am a former alarm company owner and was looking for for a quick,simple and portable alarm system with dialer. After looking over the various systems and reviews I settled on the Mace 80355.The unit I received had a defective I.R. unit. I called Mace and explained the problem to them. They apologized for the inconvenience and are sending a replacement unit to me.I would like to add that the product installation manual is easy to follow and was most likely written (re-written?) by a native American-English speaker.

Reviews.Title: I have two of these alarm systems
Reviews.Author: Tally
Reviews.Content: This is my second Mace Wireless Home Security System. My first one was installed in my small office last year. The second is for my home. I like that it is a single control unit and is easy to install. Once installed, it just works. The instructions, though, are poorly written and not very clear. Fortunately, setup is not complicated.There was one glitch, though. The unit arrived and I installed it fine. But every minute or two the control unit would make a buzzing noise. I called the factory and they shipped a new unit to me. The replacement unit arrived quickly and works perfectly. Great service.Installation is easy, just mount the equipment where you want. I bought additional motion sensors and programming them was simple. Just switch the control unit to learn mode for the desired sensor channel and wave your hand in front of the sensor. When you hear a beep, the sensor is connected. I connected the control unit to my telephone line. I used a VoIP adapter so I would not tie up my regular house line. I plugged in a telephone. Programming the numbers was simple. The unit calls my cell phone when the alarm goes off. I test the alarm every week to make sure it goes off and calls my cell phone. The remote control that I use for my office also works for the system at home. No need for me to buy a second remote control for the home. I just had to program the home control unit to recognize my remote.I also got the wireless siren to mount outside. Now the neighbors know when the alarm goes off. Considering that we have had a rash of burgluries in the neighborhood, that is a nice feature.The only thing that would make this system better would be if it connected to the Internet.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: Mikeman
Reviews.Content: Bought this around six months ago after the installation hassles of the remote sensors this works well and we are happy and feel secure with it installed.

Reviews.Title: Solid system
Reviews.Author: RoyRipple
Reviews.Content: It works as avertised. Easy to install and program. The only negative is that you cannot use the call-in feature to operate it remotely if you wish to keep your answer and message feature on your phone. the manual doesnot tell you that. i am very happy with the unit and at such an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Hawk2172
Reviews.Content: Wireless Home Security SystemPro= Good product, fairly easy to program once you read all documentation twice.Con= Would be much better system if the control unit had a lighted display. When Icome home, house is dark and only have 20 seconds to disarm. Need a flashlight toshine on unit to disarm.

Reviews.Title: Mace Wireless Security
Reviews.Author: Richard "Richard Wade"
Reviews.Content: This unit really provides good value for the money. I chose primarily to rely upon motion sensors available with the control unit, and the procedure for the control unit to learn those sensors was not overly complicated.  I did use the door/window sensor in one area and it also was easily installed.  I like the "calling" feature of the unit.  It will dial sequentially up to five numbers when the sensors detect an intruder.  The unit makes a lot of noise when tripped...and with the siren outside...even more...but without some type of notification system it relies too much on a neighbor calling.  Thus, the calling feature really makes a difference, especially if one of the numbers input is "911."  Signal range did not present a problem in my two level house.  I ordered an extra remote because it is more convenient for each person to have one, and the remotes do not have any range problems.  Including everything that I bought, I think I spent around $300.  Not bad for a system, and no monthly monitoring fees.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Home Security System
Reviews.Author: Bill F.
Reviews.Content: I rate this home security system as top notch.  It was easy to install and program by just following the simple product instructions provided.  I tested it on several occasions and it performs as it is designed to do.  I would recommend this to anyone looking at a home protection alarm system.  It beats paying the high price of other conventional alarm company systems, plus it immediately calls the pre-programmed telephone numbers to notify you or the Police in case of an unauthorized entry.

Reviews.Title: A little peace of mind...
Reviews.Author: Colleen Sibthorp
Reviews.Content: Its easy to set up, has a good range, the alarm is loud, but also offers a silent alarm function, and you can expand its capabilities easily, by adding additional sensors.  It installed in 30 minutes and has been trouble-free since.

Reviews.Title: Easy Setup
Reviews.Author: T. Reitenbach
Reviews.Content: Setup took less than an hour and I found the instructions to be complete and clear.  Only complaint after a week's use is we've already had one false alarm from a motion detector.  That is to say I have been unable to determine what could have triggered it.  Otherwise a good product for the price.

Reviews.Title: some bugs
Reviews.Author: J. McGuffey "Ghog"
Reviews.Content: I bought this product some time ago and when it works it works fine however the product has never really worked as it should have. The problem I have is the main alarm box has never worked when plugged into the wall but it dose work well on battery power I really only need to use it a couple times a week so I e-mailed the company and they simply said to plug it into the wall I told them that that was the problem but they never got back to me so if you don't mind buying all the batteries for this thing it dose work

Reviews.Title: EASY SET UP.
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: HARD TO SET UP AT FIRST, BUT ONCE SET UP IS COMPLETED THE SYSTEM WORKS FINE WORKS FINE. WHEN THE ALARM WAS TESTED IT CALLED MY CELL PHONE.

Reviews.Title: Overpriced for what you get
Reviews.Author: Vizunthing
Reviews.Content: Pros:  It works, and will alarm on motion or contact openCons: Cheap - made in China, looks like it came from the dollar store.Other thoughts:  You HAVE to use both the motion detector AND the contacts, otherwise you get an immediate alarm after you arm.  I have to play a bit more to see if I can remove the contacts (as they don't fit the door in my office).  I also set the alarm off about 10 times and it never called me, so the phone portion is questionable.  For $30 this might be ok, for over $80 - look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: I'm impressed!
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I used to work for an alarm Co and have installed many systems. What this system can do for the price amazes me. It's easy to install in a very short time. You could spend much more for a system that will not perform any better than this one.

Reviews.Title: Cheap system
Reviews.Author: Special_ed
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. This system does everything that it says it does. Gives me a sense of well being. It calls me and lets me have a conversation with my house. Its not a 300.00 dollar monitored system. You are the monitor.  For its price, it does a really great job

Reviews.Title: Works as Described
Reviews.Author: Greenacres
Reviews.Content: Very happy with entire set up of this system with motion sensors and siren.  Works as described.  Fairy easy to program.  Just take your time and pay attention to screen.  Best way for the door sensors and motions sensors and siren to be "learned" by the control panel is to have them right near the control panel.  Then move them to where they will be mounted around the house and garage..  Worked best for us doing it this way.  Could not get sensor to "learn" units when they were in mounted locations. I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: home security
Reviews.Author: designer
Reviews.Content: This works great, and we plan to add more pieces.  Sometimes hard to remember to turn on and off if u have never had a system before.

Reviews.Title: Dim display
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: Great system ,but poor display-too dim and hard to read. Would be nice if it was backlit.Best system for the price.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: T
Reviews.Content: Not too complicated once you read through & set it up the first time, although directions could be clearer. But it works just as described & delivers just what you expect from the description.

Reviews.Title: Works as described.
Reviews.Author: riku
Reviews.Content: Works as described. Has to go through the complete manual to do the configuration and install. The battery died out after two weeks, but works great on AC power. The remote is feeble at times.

Reviews.Title: Solid Unit
Reviews.Author: W. Kaminsky
Reviews.Content: Nicely built console, doesn't have that cheap feel to it. The buttons all have a nice positive feel, and the unit is fairly easy to learn to operate. I've had similar units in the past from other manufacturers, at roughly this same price point, and this Mace unit just feels better.

Reviews.Title: Excelente!
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Excelente producto!!! es de muy fácil instalación, el producto trae todo lo que se indica en la oferta. 100% conforme con el mismo.

Reviews.Title: Great Bang for the Buck
Reviews.Author: Randal A. Donnelly
Reviews.Content: While not a top of the line security system, it does what it's supposed to do. And for the money, it can't be beat. I've had it for about a month now and it's working perfectly.I have to give props to Mace customer service. I had just glanced through the instructions for setting up a third sensor and didn't realize that additional sensors weren't automatically detected by the base unit. Mick at Mace straightened me out and also helped when I couldn't get the auto-dial out to work. Both problems were user error but Mick got me up and running quickly.One drawback to the auto-dial that has already been mentioned in another review here is that by the time you answer your cell phone, the alarm message is almost finished and you have no time to enter a command before the next number is dialed. I'm still trying to figure this one out.

Reviews.Title: Great system!
Reviews.Author: M. Kluzek
Reviews.Content: What's great about this is that it will call your cell phone and up to 4 others if someone breaks in.  Plus it is easy to set up and has a loud alarm.  The price is amazing!  Even on the Mace website they are $150 as of Jan. 2010.  My cat doesn't even trigger the motion sensor though I do.  I can now feel I'm protected.  If you want to spend more, I would consider another system where if they cut your phone line it goes off but I am happy with this.

Reviews.Title: Mace  wireless system, Model 80355
Reviews.Author: John Wong
Reviews.Content: I purchased and installed the system with no problems because I read the entire description and instructions before I began.  Some users complain about short battery life in the motion and/or door sensor. This could be a problem if the sensors are in area with lots of traffic.  I suggest the use of 9 volt lithium batteries which has 5-10 years shelf life and six times the life of an  alkaline battery. Do not use the cheap general purpose batteries.  They have very short life.  My suggestion for improving this fine system is to give an aural alarm when the batteries are weak as one does not look at the control unit all the time and use the remote for exit and entry turn on/off.  The battery in the control unit just floats in a standby mode and its shelf life is considered to be 3-4 years and seldom needs replacement.  One can find additional sensors and remotes on Ebay.  Be sure they are compatible with your model.

Reviews.Title: If you are looking for an expandable entry level system, this isn't bad...
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "theknick"
Reviews.Content: It took me a while to get around to it, but I finally installed this system.  I didn't install the window piece, just the motion detector and the main console.  It wasn't too hard and took less than an hour.It seems to work fine; when triggered it calls my cell phone like it is supposed to.  It does seem to go quiet pretty quickly and I haven't found out how to adjust that.The motion detector is pointed at some windows, but there have been no false alarms thus far.Plusses - low cost, relatively simple installation, does what I expected.Minuses - quick to shut itself off (may be adjustable; don't know).  Base unit not all that loud.Met my needs...

Reviews.Title: Nice Alarm System For The Price
Reviews.Author: S. Sun
Reviews.Content: I Like this system it was easy to use and to install. You can add more dectectors as you wish which is nice, the directions were easy to follow and I like the call feature.

Reviews.Title: weak installation instructions
Reviews.Author: R. M. Slade, Jr.
Reviews.Content: The instruction manual is not thorough and contradicts itself regardging disarming the system by phone.  Once installed properly, the equipment seems to work well so far.

Reviews.Title: We can't get this to work properly
Reviews.Author: Deannaocean
Reviews.Content: It seems to be a total waste of money. The system won't call me. My hubby - an engineer - has spent countless hours trying to get it to work. Too bad because it is for my mother with dementia in case she walks out without us knowing it.

Reviews.Title: It seems to work well so far--just purchased & installed this week.
Reviews.Author: jekking00
Reviews.Content: I decided to try this unit out since it was a middle of the road choice that was wireless and relatively easy to install but still has quite a few advanced features and customization possibilities(I was particularly looking for one that had the ability to expand or purchase additional sensors or remotes).  There has been a high number of daytime break-ins within my fairly safe apartment complex here lately.  My budget and need for just basic protection is my main reason for deciding to go with this option... versus a professionally monitord(i.e. more expensive) one!  We'll see how things go and hope to never have it triggered by an unlawful entry.

Reviews.Title: It doesnt work
Reviews.Author: Franquil Rodriguez Alonzo
Reviews.Content: That s*** it is not working. I made step by step the manuel and puff. S***, s***, s***.Maldita sea

Reviews.Title: Went with ADT
Reviews.Author: Christopher Aguilar
Reviews.Content: I like to consider myself fairly technical -  This product was a really tough thing to install. I had all kinds of problems from missing parts to just bad directions. I ended up shoving it all back into the box and calling ADT to come out and set up their alarm system. As a business owner, it was not worth my time to sit at the office and try to figure this out. If you are going to purchase this- I would suggest finding someone familiar with alarm systems to help you with it's set up and installation. I think that was, in the end, my short coming.

Reviews.Title: Inspect the Package Carefully!  Antenna Missing in Ours!
Reviews.Author: For Truth and Justice
Reviews.Content: Did not realize that the antenna was missing until we started installing the unit.  Upon closer inspection, we could see that the package had been re-sealed, but alas! it is now too late to return it.  Just hope that we can find the replacement part.  NOT HAPPY AT ALL!

Reviews.Title: ALARMA DE FACIL INSTALACION
Reviews.Author: jflores
Reviews.Content: Este es un kit muy básico, tiene la unidad de control, el control remoto, 1 detector de movimiento y 1 sensor de puerta/ventana. Dependiendo de las necesidades del usuario, debe comprar mas sensores, sirena o buscar otro kit que contenga mas elementos, para lo cual debe analizar costos.Los elementos son de muy fácil instalación y programación. Se lo puede activar y desactivar de 3 maneras: directamente desde la unidad de control, mediante el control remoto o vía telefónica.La respuesta de la alarma al activarse es rápida, llama a los teléfonos programados recibiéndose el mensaje previamente grabado, donde se debe indicar como desactivar la alarma.En resumen, la alarma funciona tal como lo anuncia el fabricante, y para el precio (en Amazon tiene menor precio que en la página web del fabricante),es una excelente opción.Hay comentarios de otros compradores que son muy interesantes, incluso algunos le han hecho adaptaciones al equipo.Recomiendo leerlos.COMENTARIO: Todas mis compras en Amazon han sido enviadas con éxito por medio de UPS o USPS, pero en este caso fue por medio de LASERSHIP. Cuando me enteré de eso, revise comentarios sobre esa empresa y mas había quejas que otra cosa, así que me preocupé un poco, pero en mi caso, el paquete llegó en buenas condiciones en el tiempo programado.
